Es un shooter muy disfrutable con una historia y gameplay excelentes. Ha envejecido bastante mejor que su precuela (Half life) y es muy divertido. Recomendado para todo amante de los videojuegos e imprescindible para cualquier usuario de pc.

Well made game for the time. I appreciate the time developers put into level design. The characters are not as as developed as compared to today's standards. It is overall an enjoyable game by itself with plenty of mod capabilities to prove fun for a later generation.

Excelente, en su tiempo (2004) no me gustaba porque era necesario instalar steam, algo completamente novedoso y en mi casa no habia buena conexi√≥n. Adem√°s la pc no era muy buena y lo pude jugar despu√©s de que me compren una placa de video nueva... por lo que lo jugue por 2007/2008 creo. 

  Todavia no me decido si es mejor que el 1, creo... que no (m√°s existiendo Black Mesa hoy d√≠a) pero alcanza niveles muy altos en los √∫ltimos niveles, especialmente "anticiudadano uno" y "sigan a Freeman". 

 El dise√±o de la Ciudadela se me hizo un poco decepcionante (me recordaba un poco a Star Wars 1 La amenaza fantasma) pero eran otros tiempos, seguramente en un remake seria mas espectacular, al igual que Xen en half-life 1 era algo esteril con un gran potencial, en un mod o remake la ciudadela podria ser mucho mas imponente y con un aspecto mas alienigena. 

 Por favor, si hacen otro half-life, no agreguen logros como encontrar lambdas o llevar un enano de jardin/sombrero/pizza desde el principio al final etc, son una perdida de tiempo! que sea algo enfocado en la historia o habilidad.

Never played a Half Life game in my life before. Because of Alyx(which I played before everything else), I was very intrigued and played HL,HL2,EP1,EP2,Lost Coast. What can I say, HL2 is a masterpiece, less so HL1 and the episodes but HL2 and Alyx are must play and amazing games, masterpieces even.

This is one of the best games I have ever played. The fact that it was made in 2004 but has graphics that look like there from like 2019 or 2020 is shocking. If you love story, action, a little bit of horror and games that never get old, this game is for you. (Just as a note I don't normally put capital letters or put you as y-o-u i normally put it as u. But it is an AMAZING game and if you should really try it. I have 161.8 hours on this damn game!)

This game is absolutely breathtaking. When I first booted up the game the story telling was amazing, how it seamlessly meshes with actual gameplay makes the immersion feel real.  The level design is crazy good and easy to understand without a walkthrough. This series is just WOW, you feel like you want to come back everytime you finish it.
Anos e anos de Half Life 2, ainda vale muito a pena. A revolu√ß√£o dos jogos veio a partir desse jogo.
Damn man, I wish I got into these games long ago, this was fantastic, not as good as the first, but still great.

Well, this is just an unpopular opinion.
I think Half Life 2 isn't a good sequel game whatsoever.  In spite of the fact that I'm really into dystopian scenarios, I don't like Half Life 2's scenario. It seriously lacks of storytelling and has a poor scenario unlike Half Life 1. At first glance the game looks like a game with stereotypical 1984 theme however, the oppressive government backed by aliens differs the game from other stereotypical 1984 games. Although Gordon Freeman, the protagonist, is an renowned Scientist from Black Mesa, there's nothing he acts like a scientist does or does science stuff. Only the NPCs highlight Gordon Freeman is actually a scientist. Half life 1 is an absorbing game with nearly nonstop action and thrill whereas Half Life 2 progresses immensely slow. One of, maybe the most, the boring part of the game is almost two thirds of the game consists of missions like going A to B so, you know what will happen next at some point. The fact that Gordon has no voiceline makes it more annoying, watching the NPCs talking to Gordon is so much boring it makes mee feel like a ghost. The only part I enjoyed the game was massacring zombies in Ravenholm. As I mentioned earlier, Half Life 2 seriously lacks of storytelling e.g. the game does not even tell you anything about whether the combines are human or not, neither does mention about the seven hour war. You have to read press clippings left and right to fully grasp Half Life 2's lore. What's even worse is the press clippings are in shitty resolutions, what a sick joke! In Half Life 1 we learn nearly everything about Black Mesa and the game itself while playing. I find the game's physics engine way too overrated because you don't need to resort to it except for puzzle parts. Also the weapons don't have ricochet, shooting feels so null. Furthermore, the ending sucks so bad, at the ending I was like "Is that it? Really?". After suffering because of hours of driving A to B and awaiting for a shocking ending what I got was blowing up the Citadel LOL! It was so banal; anyways, both DLCs could have been made as a single sequel game but Valve decided to make money instead of making the third installment of HL series. I think if Half Life 2 had been made under a different name than Half Life, it wouldn't be this bad to me because I don't think Half Life 2 is a good sequel game overall.
v e r i   n i c e

This game is a must have.
The Graphics are a bit aged, but there are countless mods like MMod or ReShade.
Story wise 10/10
Level design 9/10
Gunplay 8/10, there are no crossbow combine making gameplay just hitscan hell.
Physics are implemented well, at some parts a bit too much we're you HAVE to use the Gravity Gun.
And Dynamic Story telling. There are NO cutscenes in the game, other than the Intro.
A Very good game overall. 10/10
